intro: Sonerila coimbatorensis, commonly known as the Coimbatore sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has elliptical, leathery leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
